text_section1.text: Of all the wishes in a man's thoughts, why should he wish for this?
The beams were sick with dry rot and the winds whistled through the cracks... but the old mansion in the marshes meant everything to Silas Black -- he didn't mean to give it up easily...
This was his home! It was filled with his treasures -- his books -- gathered from every corner of the globe! Was he to lose all this because of a mere slip of paper?

text_section2.text: Tomorrow my nephew will be twenty one -- by the terms of my brother's will, he will inherit all this! It isn't fair!

text_section1.text: Ah -- good evening, William -- I - I wasn't expecting you until tomorrow!

text_section2.text: Hello, Uncle -- I'm leaving on a vacation tomorrow -- just thought I'd drop in to look over the place -- I may want to clear out some of this junk!

text_section1.text: Is there nothing in all this great wealth of knowledge to help me? To help me keep what should be rightfully mine?
You're not going to sell my books?

text_section2.text: Sell? -- Come now, Uncle, who would buy this smelly stuff? They're musty -- rotting -- and unsanitary!

text_section1.text: No! They're great treasures! They contain secrets of the ages! Wondrous stores of knowledge lost to many generations!

text_section2.text: Tommyrot! You've lost yourself in these old volumes! Lost your touch with reality!

text_section1.text: No! No! -- I'll prove it to you! I shall perform an experiment from the diary of Merlin himself -- the master magician of all time!
Old Silas studied the yellow pages of the dusty volumes confidently -- his bony fingers measured each ounce of chemicals, weighed them carefully...
Here -- you see -- by this chemical reaction, I can change any object to gold -- any object -- even this apple on my desk!
Ha, ha! Uncle, you send me! -- Well, let's try it -- see if this hocus pocus works --

text_section2.text: You will not scoff when you try to bite into a golden apple, William!

text_section1.text: It had to work! This experiment meant everything to Silas -- a few drops of the chemical on the apple -- and then --

text_section2.text: Gold! Gold! Gold! Gold! Bright and yellow, hard and cold!

text_section1.text: Come on how, Uncle -- what's the trick? How did you do it? What is this thing, really?

text_section2.text: It is gold, nephew -- the shining ore that grinds men to the dust of misery! Before whose image bow the vulgar great! The vainly rich -- the miserable proud!

text_section1.text: William couldn't help smiling at his uncle's flowery quotes -- but there was one way to make sure -- boldly, he bit into the shiny apple --

text_section2.text: I thought so! Merely an illusion -- it's still an apple -- and a tasty one at that!

text_section1.text: It is gold, I tell you! Perhaps a few more drops of the chemical! More! More!
But William had seen quite enough! The marshes echoed to his laughter as he left the old man to his failure --

text_section2.text: Now I really need a rest! I'll drop you a card, Uncle... you'll hear from me --

text_section4.text: Wait! William, wait! Something went wrong!

text_section1.text: Where did I fail? What did I overlook? Merlin, my guide, my philosopher, my friend! Give me a sign -- a key to your powers!
Wait! Here it is! Something I overlooked! It says: look into the flame of a candle and utter my name -- and your wish will come to pass!
Oh, Merlin, master of sorcery, make this apple turn to gold!
It's gold! Real gold! Now I can have anything I want! What do I wish most of all?
William! I wish he never returns! I wish he disappears! Do you hear me, Merlin!!
Deep in the swamps, a shadow falls upon the landscape -- and suddenly flicks away into nothingness!
Later -- old Silas plodded through the marshes, searching for a sign of his nephew --

text_section2.text: William! William! Can you hear me?

text_section1.text: -- and saw --
Stricken with remorse, the old man ran! -- back home -- to the rotting mansion! To the creaking rusting monument to his sin!

text_section2.text: What have I done! Oh, what have I done!

text_section1.text: He lay there all night -- and when the dawn reached through the cracks in the wall --
Are you looking for someone, Sheriff?

text_section2.text: I'm afraid we have bad news for you Silas -- your nephew, William --

text_section1.text: William? He was exploring the marshes -- a vacation, he called it!

text_section2.text: I'm afraid he's done for -- lost in the swamps! We found his hat!

text_section1.text: I can't believe it! Only yesterday, he said: `I need a rest, uncle -- I'll write to you!'
A post card! The Sheriff must have dropped it!
Why -- it's William's handwriting!
With trembling hands, Silas held the card to the candle to read it in the dim light of the room! And suddenly...
... Suddenly, the great house was empty... nothing stirred -- except the card that fluttered in the wind whistling through the cracks.

text_section2.text: Having a wonderful time -- wish you were here! P.s. Give my regards to Merlin! Uncle Silas
